spells.name: Force Tentacle
spells.target: One random nearby enemy
spells.damage:
3rd level spell: 3d10 damage.
5th level spell: 5d10 damage.
7th level spell: 7d10 damage.
9th level spell: 9d10 damage.
spells.adventurerFeat: You can now also target far away enemies.
spells.championFeat: This spell’s damage dice increase by one size to d12s.
spells.epicFeat: One battle per day, you can deal half damage on a natural even miss with this spell.

spells.name: Chaos Ray
spells.target: One nearby or far away enemy
spells.evenHit: As a hit, plus another nearby enemy takes half damage.
spells.miss: 1d6 damage to a different nearby enemy.
spells.damage:
3rd level spell 4d6 damage: 1d10 damage on a miss.
5th level spell 6d6 damage: 2d12 damage on a miss.
7th level spell 6d10 damage: 3d12 damage on a miss.
9th level spell 8d10 damage: 5d12 damage on a miss.

spells.name: Blarrrrgh!
spells.target: 1d6 nearby enemies
spells.hit:
3d6 + Charisma damage, and roll a d4 for the effect (same damage for all targets but a separate effect for each one).
d4 Effect
1 The target is dazed (save ends).
2 The target is weakened (save ends).
3 The target is hampered until the end of your next turn.
4 The target is confused until the end of your next turn.
spells.damage:
3rd level spell: 6d6 damage.
5th level spell: 6d10 damage.
7th level spell: 10d10 damage.
9th level spell: 2d8 x 10 damage.

spells.name: Chaos Blessing
spells.effect:
Effect: Roll a d20 to determine which effect the blessing grants. Higher-level versions of the spell improve the first three blessings, but you still get only the blessing you roll.
d20 Effect
1–4 Gift—You or one of your nearby allies gains 7 temporary hit points.
5–8 Resilience—You gain 7 temporary hit points.
9–12 Aura/tentacles—The next enemy that moves to engage you this battle takes 2d6 damage.
13–16 Defense bonus—You gain a +2 bonus to the defense of your choice (AC, PD, or MD) until an attack against that defense misses you or until the end of the battle.
17–20 Healing—You or your nearby ally with the fewest hit points can heal using a recovery. (If you’re the one with the fewest hit points among you and your nearby allies, it’s you.)
3rd level spell: gift and resilience now grant 12 temporary hit points; aura/tentacles damage is 2d10.
5th level spell: gift and resilience now grant 20 temporary hit points; aura/tentacles damage is 4d10.
7th level spell: gift and resilience now grant 35 temporary hit points; aura/tentacles damage is 6d8.
9th level spell: gift and resilience now grant 60 temporary hit points; aura/tentacles damage is 10d8.
spells.adventurerFeat: The defense bonus effect now applies to all the target’s defenses (and therefore ends as soon as the target is missed by an attack).
spells.championFeat: A number of times per day equal to your highest non-Charisma modifier, you can roll twice when you cast chaos blessing and gain both effects (reroll a duplicate result).
spells.epicFeat: The damage dice for the aura/tentacles effect increase by one size (for example, d8s to d10s).

spells.name: Warped Healing
spells.target: Two nearby allies, or you and one nearby ally
spells.effect:
Randomly choose one of the targets. That target can heal using a recovery. The other target gains 10 temporary hit points and grows a strange eye, limb, or other physical feature that lasts as long as the temporary hit points do.
3rd level spell: 20 temporary hit points.
5th level spell: 30 temporary hit points.
7th level spell: 45 temporary hit points.
9th level spell: 70 temporary hit points.

spells.name: Castigation (1st level+)
spells.target: One enemy you are engaged with if possible; if not, then one nearby enemy
spells.hit: 1d8 + Charisma psychic damage. Hit vs. a Staggered Target: As a hit, except there is no damage roll; the target takes maximum damage.
spells.damage:
3rd level spell: 3d6 damage.
5th level spell: 5d6 damage.
7th level spell: 5d8 damage.
9th level spell: 6d10 damage.
spells.adventurerFeat: When you hit a demon with this spell, it’s also hampered (save ends).
spells.championFeat: The damage dice for the spell increase by one size (for example, d6s to d8s).
spells.epicFeat: The spell now deals half damage on a miss.

spells.name: Terribly Spiky Armor (3rd level+)
spells.effect:
Until the end of the battle, you gain a +3 bonus to AC and when an enemy engaged with you misses you with an attack, it takes 3d6 + Charisma damage.
5th level spell: 5d6 damage.
7th level spell: 5d8 damage.
9th level spell: 7d10 damage.

spells.name: Yours! (1st level+)
spells.target: You or one ally in the battle, chosen randomly
spells.effect:
Roll a d20.
1–10: The target can heal using a recovery.
11–20: The target can make a basic attack as a free action.
spells.adventurerFeat: When this spell allows a target to attack, the attack deals half damage on a miss instead of normal miss damage.
spells.championFeat: The target can move as a free action before using a recovery or attacking.
spells.epicFeat: When the target heals using a recovery, it adds hit points equal to 1d10 x the escalation die to that healing.

spells.name: Ours! (1st level+)
spells.target: One nearby ally
spells.effect: The target can heal using a free recovery, adding hit points equal to 1d6 x the escalation die to that healing. Unless you or the target is a dwarf, randomly choose one of the target’s true magic items. You actively gain that item’s quirk until the end of the day.

spells.name: Fiery Claw (1st level+)
spells.special: This spell attack ignores all the target’s resistances.
spells.target: One nearby enemy
spells.hit: 1d8 + Charisma fire damage, and the target loses its resist damage abilities, if any (hard save ends, 16+).
spells.damage:
3rd level spell 3d8 damage.
5th level spell 5d8 damage.
7th level spell 7d8 damage.
9th level spell 9d8 damage.
spells.adventurerFeat: This spell can now deal holy damage instead of fire damage.
spells.championFeat: The damage dice for this spell increase from d8s to d10s.
spells.epicFeat: This spell now deals half damage on a miss.

spells.name: Final Wrath (5th level+)
spells.target: 1d4 nearby enemies in a group
spells.evenHit: As a hit, plus if the target is staggered after the attack, it’s also stunned until the end of its next turn.
spells.damage:
7th level spell: 9d10 damage.
9th level spell: 2d6 x 10 damage.
spells.championFeat: This spell now deals half damage on a miss.
spells.epicFeat: This spell now targets 2d3 enemies in a group.

spells.name: War Drums (1st level+)
spells.effect:
The next natural odd attack roll you or one of your allies makes this battle that hits an enemy deals 13 extra damage.
3rd level spell: 23 extra damage.
5th level spell: 33 extra damage.
7th level spell: 53 extra damage.
9th level spell: 83 extra damage.
spells.adventurerFeat: Add your Charisma modifier to the extra damage (double your Charisma modifier at 5th level; triple it at 8th level).
spells.championFeat: When you cast this spell, each nearby enemy that’s staggered also takes 2d6 thunder damage (4d6 thunder damage at 8th level).
spells.epicFeat: When this spell’s effect deals the extra damage, you can roll a hard save (16+). If you succeed, the war drums keep beating and the effect extends to the next natural odd hit this battle! (And so on if you keep succeeding.)

spells.name: Savage Endings (3rd level+)
spells.target: Each nearby creature that’s staggered (yes, including allies, even those who are dying)
spells.effect:
Each target takes 5d6 + Charisma damage.
5th level spell: 5d8 damage.
7th level spell: 7d10 damage.
9th level spell: 10d10 damage.
spells.adventurerFeat: The spell no longer targets your allies.
spells.championFeat: The spell’s damage dice increase by one size (for example, d10s to d12s).
spells.epicFeat: When you drop one or more non-mook creatures to 0 hp with this spell, you can heal using a free recovery.

spells.name: Silver Arrows (1st level+)
spells.target: 1d3 nearby enemies
spells.effect:
The target takes 4 force damage.
3rd level spell: 7 damage.
5th level spell: 10 damage.
7th level spell: 14 damage.
9th level spell: 27 damage.
spells.adventurerFeat: This spell now targets 1d4 nearby or far away enemies.
spells.championFeat: This spell now targets 1d6 nearby or far away enemies.
spells.epicFeat: This spell now targets a number of nearby or far away enemies equal to the escalation die.

spells.name: Cascading Power (5th level+)
spells.target: A number of random nearby creatures equal to the escalation die
spells.effect:
The targets are embroiled in silver fire! Each targeted ally can roll an immediate easy save (6+); if that ally succeeds, they regain one daily or recharge power of their choice. Then each targeted enemy takes damage equal to 1d10 x the escalation die.
After the damage, roll the escalation die and use the new result.
7th level spell: Damage equal to 2d6 x the escalation die.
9th level spell: Damage equal to 2d12 x the escalation die.

spells.name: Shards of Magic (1st level+)
spells.target: One nearby or far away enemy
spells.evenHit: 1d6 + Charisma force damage, and you can roll a hard save (16+). If you succeed, you get an extra standard action this turn.
spells.evenMiss: You can teleport to a nearby location you can see as a free action.
spells.damage:
3rd level spell: Even hit:3d6 damage; Odd hit: 10 ongoing damage.
5th level spell: Even hit:5d6 damage; Odd hit: 18 ongoing damage.
7th level spell: Even hit:5d8 damage; Odd hit: 28 ongoing damage.
9th level spell: Even hit:7d10 damage; Odd hit: 40 ongoing damage.
spells.adventurerFeat: A natural odd miss now deals damage equal to your level.
spells.championFeat: A natural odd miss now deals half the force damage an even hit would have dealt.
spells.epicFeat: A natural even miss now allows you to teleport to a far away location you can see as a free action.

spells.name: Coronation (3rd level+)
spells.effect: Until the end of the battle, when a staggered enemy hits you with an attack, you can make the following attack against that enemy as a free action after the attack.
spells.hit: The target is confused until the end of its next turn.
spells.championFeat: Once per battle when a staggered enemy misses you with an attack while this spell’s effect is active, you can make the attack against that enemy.
spells.epicFeat: When you make a natural even roll with a coronation attack, you can have the target become confused (save ends) instead of taking damage.

spells.name: Bolt and Thunder (1st level+)
spells.target: One nearby enemy
spells.hit: 1d4 + Charisma lightning damage, and a different random nearby enemy takes the same amount of thunder damage.
spells.damage:
3rd level spell: 2d6 damage.
5th level spell: 3d6 damage.
7th level spell: 5d6 damage.
9th level spell: 5d8 damage.
spells.adventurerFeat: This spell now deals damage equal to your level on a miss.
spells.championFeat: The damage dice for this spell increase by one size (for example, from 3d6 to 3d8).
spells.epicFeat: This spell now deals half damage on a miss.

spells.name: The Final Surge (3rd level+)
spells.effect:
You and each of your nearby allies each heal hit points equal to 1d6 x the number of recoveries that character has expended this day. (And no, free recoveries don’t count;this spell only counts the resources you’ve expended.)
5th level spell: 1d10 x the number of recoveries.
7th level spell: 2d6 x the number of recoveries.
9th level spell: 2d10 x the number of recoveries.

spells.name: Tortured Scream (1st level+)
spells.target: One nearby enemy
spells.special: When you cast the spell, you or a willing nearby ally of your choice loses 1d6 hit points.
spells.damage:
3rd level spell: 6d6 damage, you or ally loses 2d6 hit points.
5th level spell: 6d10 damage, you or ally loses 4d6 hit points.
7th level spell: 10d10 damage, you or ally loses 6d6 hit points.
9th level spell: 2d8 x 10 damage, you or ally loses 8d6 hit points.
spells.adventurerFeat: The spell now deals half damage on a miss.
spells.championFeat: You or an ally now lose one less die of hit points (for example, 3d6 instead of 4d6).
spells.epicFeat: The first time each battle you miss with this spell, if the escalation die is 3+, you can reroll the attack by having you or your ally lose the same amount of hit points again.

spells.name: Trace of Corruption (1st level+)
spells.target: You or one nearby ally; the target must have a positive or conflicted relationship with a villainous icon
spells.effect: The target rolls a save against each save ends effect affecting it. Then the target can heal using a recovery from a nearby ally (target’s choice, even if that ally isn’t willing).

spells.name: Evil Touch (1st level+)
spells.target: One enemy engaged with you
spells.evenHit: As a hit, plus you gain 5 temporary hit points if the target drops to 0 hp during the battle.
spells.damage:
3rd level spell: 3d10 damage, 8 temporary hit points.
5th level spell: 5d10 damage, 10 temporary hit points.
7th level spell: 7d10 damage, 15 temporary hit points.
9th level spell: 9d10 damage, 25 temporary hit points.
spells.adventurerFeat: This spell now deals half damage on a miss.
spells.championFeat: When the target drops to 0 hp, instead of gaining temporary hit points, you can choose to deal that amount of negative energy damage to one nearby enemy as a free action.
spells.epicFeat: This spell can now target a nearby enemy.

spells.name: Unsummoning (7th level+)
spells.target: One nearby non-undead enemy that the GM hasn’t given a proper name, or that doesn’t play a key role in the current storyline
spells.hit:
The target is sent elsewhere, possibly to a location that’s close enough for the PCs to have to deal with it in a subsequent battle. It might also go somewhere “interesting.”
Replace the target with the GM’s choice of an undamaged and hostile undead creature that is one level lower than the original target. If the target was a large or double-strength creature, the replacement must be large or double-strength, or perhaps two normal undead instead of one show up. Ditto for huge/triple-strength targets. Therefore you’re only slightly reducing the raw power of the opposition; the advantage of using the spell is that you’re getting rid of an enemy you match up badly against and dropping the level of the opposition by one. The disadvantage, of course, is that you’ll probably have to face that enemy again.
spells.damage: 9th level spell: 8d10 + Charisma psychic damage on a miss.
spells.championFeat: This spell can now also target an entire mob of mooks. If the attack hits, replace them with a mob of undead mooks that is one level lower.
spells.epicFeat: You don’t expend the spell when you miss with it.

spells.name: Holy Spark (1st level+)
spells.target: One nearby enemy
spells.hit: 1d8 + Charisma holy damage, and one nearby ally gains 3 temporary hit points.
spells.damage:
3rd level spell: 3d8 damage, 5 temporary hit points.
5th level spell: 5d8 damage, 8 temporary hit points.
7th level spell: 7d8 damage, 10 temporary hit points.
9th level spell: 9d8 damage, 15 temporary hit points.
spells.adventurerFeat: When you miss with the spell, one of your nearby allies now gains the temporary hit points.
spells.championFeat: This spell now deals half damage on a miss.
spells.epicFeat: You can now target a far away enemy with this spell. In addition, the spell’s damage dice increase by one size from d8s to d10s.

spells.name: Temple Bells (1st level+)
spells.target: You and each nearby ally that has 10 hp or fewer
spells.effect:
The target can heal using a recovery.
3rd level spell: Target with 20 hp or fewer.
5th level spell: Target with 40 hp or fewer.
7th level spell: Target with 60 hp or fewer.
9th level spell: Target with 100 hp or fewer.
spells.adventurerFeat: One target that heals can also roll a save against a save ends effect.
spells.championFeat: The recovery is now free.
spells.epicFeat: Add 50 hp to the hit point threshold for targets that can be affected.

spells.name: Shadow Dance (1st level+)
spells.target: Two nearby creatures, enemies or allies (including you)
spells.effect:
The targets teleport and swap places. Each teleported enemy takes 1d6 damage. You and your allies don’t take damage from teleporting.
3rd level spell: 2d6 damage.
5th level spell: 2d10 damage.
7th level spell: 3d12 damage.
9th level spell: 4d12 damage.
spells.adventurerFeat: Once per day, one or more targets of the spell can be far away.
spells.championFeat: The damage increases by one die (for example, 2d10 becomes 3d10).
spells.epicFeat: The spell can now target up to three nearby creatures.

spells.name: Step into Shadow (3rd level+)
spells.effect:
Remove yourself from the battle (you can’t be targeted by attacks or effects while in the shadows). At the start of your next turn, return to the battle nearby your previous location and roll a d6 to determine a random benefit you gain from coming out of the shadows.
1–4: You can heal using a recovery.
5+: You deal double damage to the first target you hit with a chaos mage spell this turn.
spells.championFeat: You can choose to add +1 to the d6 roll after seeing it.
spells.epicFeat: If you roll 6+, you gain both effects.

spells.name: Twisted beam (1st level+)
spells.target: One nearby enemy
spells.oddHit: Lightning damage equal to half the damage from a natural even hit, and you can roll another twisted beam attack against an enemy you haven’t targeted with it this turn.
spells.evenMiss:
3 ongoing acid damage.
3rd level spell: 3d6 damage, 6 ongoing damage.
5th level spell: 5d6 damage, 9 ongoing damage.
7th level spell: 7d8 damage, 12 ongoing damage.
9th level spell: 9d8 damage, 18 ongoing damage.
spells.adventurerFeat: This spell can now target far away enemies.
spells.championFeat: A natural odd miss now deals half natural even hit damage.
spells.epicFeat: The first save against the ongoing damage from a natural even miss is a hard save (16+). The second and subsequent saves are normal.

spells.name: Ancient Scales (3rd level+)
spells.effect: Until the end of the battle, you have flight while the escalation die is even. While the escalation die is odd, you can cast twisted beam once during your turn as a quick action.
